articles.title: In Rajasthan Dalit Child's Killing, New Crisis For Ashok Gehlot: 10 Facts
articles.description: A Dalit boy's death in Rajasthan after his teacher allegedly assaulted him for drinking water from a pot meant for "upper castes" threatens to turn into a political crisis for the ruling Congress.
articles.content:
• Besides attacks from the Opposition BJP, the Ashok Gehlot government is also facing the heat from within its ranks.

articles.description: Responding to the latest development, China, without mentioning India or the US, said its scientific research activities are in accordance with international law and should not be interfered with by "third parties”. | World News

articles.title: Audio Leak Of Karnataka Minister: "We're Managing Government, Not Running It"
articles.description: A Karnataka minister's comments, leaked to the press early this morning, caused new embarrassment to Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai, who today confirmed that the comments are authentic but taken out of context.
articles.content:
Recent months for Mr Bommai have allowed critics to allege that he has lost his grip over the state.

articles.title: 31 New Ministers In Bihar, Most From Tejashwi Yadav's Party: 10 Points
articles.description: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar expanded his cabinet today, with the biggest chunk of seats going to alliance partner Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD). The new ministers were administered the oath of office by Governor Phagu Chauhan.
articles.content:
• A total of 31 ministers were inducted into the Bihar cabinet today. The RJD got 16 ministerial berths, followed by the Janata Dal (United) which kept 11.

articles.author: TN National Desk
articles.title: Seven killed, several injured as bus carrying ITBP jawans falls into roadside riverbed in J&K after brake fail
articles.description: The vehicle carrying Indo-Tibetan Border Police personnel met with an accident near Chandanwari. The jawans were deputed in the area for Amarnath Yatra.

articles.title: Kashmiri Pandit shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Shopian, brother injured
articles.description: A Kashmiri Pandit has been shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Shopian. The victim's brother has also been injured.
articles.content:
Terrorists have shot dead a Kashmiri Pandit in Kashmir's Shopian district and injured his brother. The victim's brother has been rushed to the hospital.
